main event: Multiple sightings of unidentified flying objects (UFOs) were reported near San Nicolas Island, California in April and May 1954 by military personnel, including a cigar-shaped object, a metallic oval object traveling at high speeds, and a brightly illuminated, silent object making radical changes in direction and altitude.
interesting points: Multiple military personnel reported sightings of UFOs, including a cigar-shaped object, a metallic oval-shaped object, and a brightly illuminated, silent object.
The metallic oval-shaped object was reported to be traveling at an estimated speed of 600 to 700 miles per hour at an altitude of approximately 3,000 feet.
The brightly illuminated object observed during night patrol made radical changes in direction and altitude, was approximately half the apparent size of the moon, and was completely silent.
Photographs were not available for any of the reported sightings.
The conclusion drawn from the reports was 'insufficient data for evaluation' due to the lack of physical evidence and conclusive details.
sighted object: cigar-shaped object, metallic oval-shaped object, brightly illuminated, silent object
witnesses: SA James E. Greppner, Lt. James G. Stephens, Lt. W. S. Gates
